action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: An older man is holding a sandwich in one hand and a blue travel mug in the other. He is wearing a striped sweater and is outdoors, possibly under a canopy or tent.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: Two giraffes walking on a sandy path in an open area with green grass and rocks in the background. There is a fence in the foreground.

This is my DESCRIPTION: An older man is holding a sandwich in one hand and a blue travel mug in the other. He is wearing a striped sweater and is outdoors, possibly under a canopy or tent.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there any wildlife or animals present in your image?

This is my DESCRIPTION: Two giraffes walking on a sandy path in an open area with green grass and rocks in the background. There is a fence in the foreground.
QUESTION: Is there any wildlife or animals present in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a person present in your image?

ANSWER: No.

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there any visible greenery or natural landscape in your image?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Is there any visible greenery or natural landscape in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there any man-made structure or object in your image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is there any man-made structure or object in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the focus of your image on a person or people?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is the focus of your image on a person or people? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any animals in your image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Are there any animals in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
